sen.j: 武田 元信（たけだ もとのぶ 康正元年（1455年） － 大永元年12月3日 (旧暦)（1521年12月31日））は武田氏若狭武田氏の第5代当主。
sen.e: Motonobu TAKEDA (1455-on 31st December in 1521) is the 5th head of the Wakasa-Takeda clan of the Takeda clan.

sen.j: 名前の元信は、管領家の通字の偏諱であり、細川勝元の「元」と武田家の通字「信」から成る。
sen.e: His name Motonobu is granting subordinates the use of a character from the superior's real name and is consisted of "Moto" from Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and "Shin" from the Takeda clan.

sen.e: His name Motonobu (元信) is granting subordinates the use of a character from the superior's real name and is consisted of 'Moto' ('元') from Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and 'Shin' ('信') from the Takeda clan.
sen.cmt: ここでは漢字が話題となっており、'Moto'や'Shin'のみではわかりにくいため、訳文に漢字を補いました。

sen.j: 応仁の乱で東軍に組し、のちに丹後国の守護にも任命され西軍の一色氏の征伐を命ぜられたが苦戦し、逆に若狭に攻め込まれることも多かった。
sen.e: Taking on the Eastern Camp during the Onin War, he was later named Shugo in the Tango Province and ordered to conquer the Isshiki clan of the Western Camp, but the fighting did not go well and in reverse he was often attacked in Wakasa.

sen.e: Motomobu was the second oldest son, but he was considered to be his father Kuninobu's successor because his older brother Nobuchika TAKEDA died early.

sen.j: 元信は家督継承してまもなく明応の政変に遭遇するが、それ以降も細川京兆家とのつながりを更に深め、若狭武田家を大繁栄させた。
sen.e: Motonobu encountered the Coup of Meio soon after family inheritance, but after that he deepened the ties with the Hosokawa-keicho family and prospered the Wakasa Takeda family.

sen.e: However, the confrontation with the Isshiki clan which was his arch rival in the Tango Province kept going back and forth, and finally he attacked the Isshiki clan with the reinforcements of the Echizen-Asakurashi (Asakura clan) in the Echizen Province during the invasion of Wakasa by the Isshiki clan.

sen.j: 大永元年（1521年）10月4日、元信は禁裏御所北門の修理費5000疋を朝廷に献上し、その功労により同月22日に守護大名（隠居後）としては異例の従三位に昇叙した。
sen.e: On October 4th in 1521 Motonobu presented 5000 hiki of renovation cost for the north gate of Kinri (the Imperial Palace), and in recognition of his service on 22nd of the same month he was unusually promoted to Jusani (Junior Third Rank) as shugo daimyo (after his retirement).

sen.cmt: October 4th in 1521→October 4, 1521とし、Jusani→Jusanmiに修正、前出の表記にあわせshugo daimyo→Shugodaimyoとしました。October 4->November 13 に変更しました。 グレゴリオ暦に合わせて "22nd of the same month"->"1st of December" に変更しました。
